<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 277, 232, 293]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 277, 907, 293]]<|/det|>
9709/32  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 303, 312, 319]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[730, 303, 907, 320]]<|/det|>
February/March 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[760, 329, 907, 345]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 357, 395, 373]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 490, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 559, 482, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 574, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 216, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(ax^{3} + 5x^{2} - 4x + b\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants, is denoted by \(\mathrm{p}(x)\). It is given that \((x + 2)\) is a factor of \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) and that when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 1)\) the remainder is 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 120, 332, 138]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(a\) and \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
By first expressing the equation \(\tan (x + 45^{\circ}) = 2\cot x + 1\) as a quadratic equation in \(\tan x\), solve the equation for \(0^{\circ}< x< 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 100, 591, 129]]<|/det|>
\[(1 - \cos x)\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = y\sin x.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 138, 381, 156]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 4\) when \(x = \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 170, 146, 188]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 168, 751, 187]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation, obtaining an expression for \(y\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 170, 920, 188]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 99, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Express \(\sqrt{7} \sin x + 2 \cos x\) in the form \(R \sin (x + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^\circ < \alpha < 90^\circ\). State the exact value of \(R\) and give \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 589, 106]]<|/det|>
Let \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \frac{5a}{(2x - a)(3a - x)}\), where \(a\) is a positive constant.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 116, 146, 134]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 116, 416, 135]]<|/det|>
Express \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) in partial fractions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 135]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 636, 91]]<|/det|>
Find the acute angle between the directions of the two lines.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
In an Argand diagram, with origin \(O\), the points \(A\), \(B\) and \(C\) represent the complex numbers \(u\), \(v\) and \(2u + v\) respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 643, 139]]<|/det|>
State fully the geometrical relationship between \(OA\) and \(BC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 425, 186, 444]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 425, 381, 444]]<|/det|>
Prove that angle \(AOB = \frac{3}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 427, 920, 446]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 670, 92]]<|/det|>
Find \(\operatorname {f}^{\prime}(x)\). Hence find the exact value of \(x\) for which \(\operatorname {f}^{\prime}(x) = -8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 568, 92]]<|/det|>

To avoid the issue of disclosure of answer-related information to candidates, all copyright acknowledgements are reproduced online in the Cambridge Assessment International Education Copyright Acknowledgements Booklet. This is produced for each series of examinations and is freely available to download at www.cambridgeinternational.org after the live examination series.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 907, 920, 932]]<|/det|>
Cambridge Assessment International Education is part of the Cambridge Assessment Group. Cambridge Assessment is the brand name of the University of Cambridge Local Examinations Syndicate (UCLES), which itself is a department of the University of Cambridge.
